summary: In Australian Aboriginal culture, life is based on a foundation of beliefs which are called the Dreamtime, or The Dreaming.
full_text: In Australian Aboriginal art, a Dreaming is a totemistic design or artwork, which can be owned by a tribal group or individual. This usage of Stanner's term was popularized by Geoffrey Bardon in the context of the Papunya Tula artist collective he established in the 1970s.
title: Dreaming (spirituality)
